text:
I didn't see this already in the list of Tomcat 6 bugs. Tomcat version is
6.0.13, which isn't in the list of versions above. File is
$CATALINA_HOME/webapps/ROOT/index.html. In the line saying, 'If you're seeing
this page, and you don't think you should be, then ___either___ you're
___either___ a user who has arrived at new installation of Tomcat, or you're an
administrator who hasn't got his/her setup quite right.', there are two
"either"s, and having one or the other removed would make the sentence
grammatically correct. Very tiny issue of the lowest priority. Thanks for all
your efforts to make such a high quality product! :)
creator: daniel.stickney@gmail.com

text:
Also on this same page, the link to the Tomcat documentation in the body of the page still points to 
tomcat-docs. The one in the navigation menu in the sidebar is correct.

There are a number of differences between index.html and index.jsp, and frankly, I don't see the reason 
for having both, except, perhaps, to allow noobs to play around with the order of the file names in the 
welcome-file-list in web.xml, but I don't think it's documented anywhere. Most people probably miss the 
fact that there are redundant files.
creator: dlivesay@mac.com
